text:
There's no shortage of problems
to solve, I think, in the world
today.

And our goal and
maybe responsibility

as engineers and
also business people

is to try and maximize the
amount of good that we can do.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

X-COR Therapeutics is about
creating a respiratory dialysis

system, so that patients
with failing lungs do not

have to be intubated or
mechanically ventilated

but rather can have small,
low-flow amounts of blood drawn

and then have their
buildup of CO2

due to the respiratory disease
vented out of their body.

Right before the
fellowship starts in May,

we'll be traveling to
Shanghai to do our next set
of preclinical studies.

We can then kind of springboard
into the fellowship year.

We absolutely realize
that fundraising in itself
is not success.

We need to be able to prove
the underlying science,

create the products
themselves and then

be able to show that
they're safe and useful.
